meanings.definition: Fixed or fastened firmly in place
meanings.sent1: The gate was secured with a strong lock.
meanings.sent2: The picture frame was secured to the wall with screws.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel secured its acorn stash in a hidden spot.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree secured it firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The seatbelt secured the child safely in the car.

meanings.sent1: The secured fortress kept the kingdom safe from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The secured document contained confidential information.
meanings.sent3: The secured area was guarded by trained security personnel.
meanings.sent4: The secured lockbox held valuable items away from thieves.
meanings.sent5: The secured fence prevented the dog from running into the street.

meanings.definition: Provided with financial security or collateral
meanings.sent1: The secured loan required the borrower to put up collateral.
meanings.sent2: The secured credit card had a low interest rate.
meanings.sent3: The secured investment offered guaranteed returns.
meanings.sent4: The secured savings account protected the funds from market fluctuations.
meanings.sent5: The secured mortgage allowed the family to buy their dream home.
